docs.snippet: CHICAGO, April 24. -- Considerable progress has been made this week in preparing for the World's Columbian Exposition. The strike of laborers lasted only three days and was unsuccessful. The men wanted $1.75 instead of $1.50. Topographical maps of...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, April 24. -- Considerable progress has been made this week in preparing for the World's Columbian Exposition. The strike of laborers lasted only three days and was unsuccessful. The men wanted $1.75 instead of $1.50. Topographical maps of the grounds have been completed and all the buildings staked off. Contractors have moved 225,000 yards of earth, 900,000 yards being the amount estimated to be moved in all.

headline.main: THE WORLD'S EXPOSITION; RAPID PROGRESS MADE IN ALL DEPARTMENTS LAST WEEK. THE STRIKE OF DAY LABORERS SUPPRESSED -- CLUB MEN ORGANIZE TO KEEP THEIR CITY CLEAN -- SENDING OUT THE DAILY LITERATURE.

docs.snippet: Mr. Sharretts of the United States Board of General Appraisers has one of the most interesting cases before him that has come up under the new Tariff act. He will take the final testimony of domestic manufacturers to-day upon the question of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Sharretts of the United States Board of General Appraisers has one of the most interesting cases before him that has come up under the new Tariff act. He will take the final testimony of domestic manufacturers to-day upon the question of the proper classification of pearl button blanks.

headline.main: CUSTOMS APPRAISERS IN DOUBT.; BOTHERED BY A MATTER OF PEARL BUTTONS AND ANOTHER OF TERRA ALBA.

docs.snippet: A Chilean refugee, recently escaped from the scene of civil warfare in the South American republic, called at THE TIMES office yesterday and desired a protest entered against the consideration shown by the Administration at Washington for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Chilean refugee, recently escaped from the scene of civil warfare in the South American republic, called at THE TIMES office yesterday and desired a protest entered against the consideration shown by the Administration at Washington for the Government of Balmaceda. He gave a dramatic and interesting narrative of the condition of affairs in Chile.
docs.abstract: Refugee's Story of Revolution's Causes, Prospects, Leaders, &c.

headline.main: THE STORY OF A REFUGEE; BALMACEDA VIEWED FROM AN INSURGENT STANDPOINT. CHILE'S TROUBLES LAID TO THE PRESIDENT'S AMBITION -- EGAN'S SYMPTHY WITH THE GOVERNMENT -- THE PROGRESS OF THE REVOLUTION.

docs.snippet: LONDON, May 20. -- Baron Bleichroder of Berlin confirms my statements in my previous letters concerning the cause of the heavy importations of gold from the United States and the object of the same, to wit, the replacing of metal which had been...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, May 20. -- Baron Bleichroder of Berlin confirms my statements in my previous letters concerning the cause of the heavy importations of gold from the United States and the object of the same, to wit, the replacing of metal which had been withdrawn from England and Germany by Russia The same high authority states that the gold brought from New-York was at a loss.
docs.abstract: Gold Purchased by Russia in United States; Reasons and Effect; Herr Barth's Views; A. M. Gibson's Criticisms

headline.main: GOLD THAT EUROPE WANTS; BLEICHRODER'S VIEWS AND ARGENTINE AFFAIRS. RUSSIA AND GERMANY AS PARTIES TO THE NEXT GREAT WAR -- HEAVY SOUTH AMERICAN DEBTS -- EUROPE'S LARGE INTEREST IN THEM.

docs.snippet: LONDON, May 23. -- For ten days the weather throughout the British islands and over a great part of the Continent has been very unseasonable. Snow, hail, disagreeable cold rain has in turns been the prevailing order. The agricultural outlook was...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, May 23. -- For ten days the weather throughout the British islands and over a great part of the Continent has been very unseasonable. Snow, hail, disagreeable cold rain has in turns been the prevailing order. The agricultural outlook was decidedly unfavorable before this recent bad weather. The Spring was very backward, the only good weather being that of the fatter part of April.
docs.abstract: Financial Outlook; TIMES'S A. M. Gibson Letter on

headline.main: FINANCIERS' MANY MOVES; GOLD WILL SOON FLOW BACK TO THIS COUNTRY. GREAT BRITAIN'S LOCAL INDEBTEDNESS INCREASED -- NO DANGER OF A PANIC IN FRANCE -- A GREAT CRASH IN BRAZIL IMMINENT.

docs.snippet: President William H. Beers of the New-York Life Insurance Company, who is now abroad, is coming home to aid in straightening out the affairs of his company. He was in Paris yesterday, and in the course of the day his son-in-law, Dr. Henry Tuck,...
docs.lead_paragraph: President William H. Beers of the New-York Life Insurance Company, who is now abroad, is coming home to aid in straightening out the affairs of his company. He was in Paris yesterday, and in the course of the day his son-in-law, Dr. Henry Tuck, received a cablegram from him stating that he would sail for New-York next Wednesday.
docs.abstract: Trustees' Meeting; Merzbacher Defalcations and Cashier Banta's Charges Discussed; Resolutions
